notes: Issue #528 reports that SKShaper.Shape() returns all-zero Codepoints on Android when the typeface is loaded via SKTypeface.FromStream(). The reporter confirmed the bug affects Android only (works on WPF/iOS) and found a workaround using SKTypeface.FromData() instead. Tested both FromStream and FromData paths on macOS with SkiaSharp 2.88.9, 3.119.2, and main (source) — all produce correct non-zero codepoints on macOS as expected. The bug is Android-specific, likely related to how the native HarfBuzz library interacts with stream-based typeface data on Android. Reproduction requires an Android device or emulator.

versionResults.notes: All four typeface loading methods (FromStream, FromData, FromFile, FromFamilyName) produce correct non-zero codepoints on macOS. Bug is Android-specific.
Same result as 2.88.9 — all paths produce correct codepoints on macOS.
All 7 existing SKShaperTest tests pass on main branch. Shaping works correctly on macOS.
